abort.no_uuid: Kodi instance does not have a unique ID. This is most likely due to an old Kodi version (17.x or below). You can configure the integration manually or upgrade to a more recent Kodi version.

credentials.description: Please enter your Kodi user name and password. These can be found in System/Settings/Network/Services.

discovery_confirm.description: Do you want to add Kodi (`{name}`) to Home Assistant?
discovery_confirm.title: Discovered Kodi

data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of the system hosting your Kodi server.

user.description: Kodi connection information. Please make sure to enable "Allow control of Kodi via HTTP" in System/Settings/Network/Services.

ws_port.description: The WebSocket port (sometimes called TCP port in Kodi). In order to connect over WebSocket, you need to enable "Allow programs ... to control Kodi" in System/Settings/Network/Services. If WebSocket is not enabled, remove the port and leave empty.

add_to_playlist.description: Adds music to the default playlist (i.e. playlistid=0).

artist_name.description: Optional artist name for filtering media.
artist_name.name: Artist name

media_id.description: Unique ID of the media entry to add (`songid` or albumid`). If not defined, Media name and Artist name are needed to search the Kodi music library.
media_id.name: Media ID

media_name.description: Optional media name for filtering media. Can be 'ALL' when Media type is 'ALBUM' and Artist name is specified, to add all songs from one artist.
media_name.name: Media name

media_type.description: Media type identifier. It must be one of 'SONG' or 'ALBUM'.
media_type.name: Media type

add_to_playlist.name: Add to playlist

call_method.description: Calls a Kodi JSONRPC API method with optional parameters. Results of the Kodi API call will be redirected in a Home Assistant event: `kodi_call_method_result`.

method.description: Name of the Kodi JSONRPC API method to be called.
method.name: Method

call_method.name: Call method
